text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
doc mcstuffins cake pop tutorial I'm
gonna be showing you how to make these
three adorable Disney doc McStuffins
characters from the doc McStuffins kids
TV show the things that you need for
today's tutorial I've got a little bit
of sticky tape I've got my cake pop
balls so if you don't have a great
recipe for your cake pop balls I will
leave a link to the cupcake addiction
recipe in the description box below I've
got a pair of scissors a couple of
ziplock bags and some melted white
chocolate I've got some melted blue
chocolate or candy melts and some skin
colored chocolate which is really just
mainly a white chocolate with just a
hint of brown and a hint of pink to give
it that skinny fleshy tone I've got some
white nonpareils or white sprinkles a
nice I've got an edible marker some
lollipop sticks a skewer a toothpick a
spoon over here I've got some little
pink roll candies so they normally come
in a multicolored roll I've got some
little pink love heart sprinkles a piece
of candy corn some white sixlets or you
can also use mint a mini Oreo cookie
I've got a piece of soft earring
licorice and a pretzel stick off to the
side I've also got my doc McStuffins
printable templates so I will leave a
link to those in the description box
below just an optional extra I've got a
polystyrene block to set my pops in
while they're drying and just a plate or
a flat tray to catch some of our
sprinkles so let's get started the first
thing that we want to do is shape our
cake pop ball so two of those balls are
going to be perfectly round the third
one for stuffies head is more like a
tapered strawberry so you just want to
rock it in your palm to kind of give it
a little bit of a pointy ER smaller top
round out the bottom edge because that's
gonna be his big nose you should have a
shaped roughly like this you want to pop
that off into the fridge for at least 15
minutes you'll see here all of mine have
been refrigerated and they're really
nice and firm you want to grab your
lollipop sticks now and we're going to
dip each of these in a different color
so we've got our three lollipop sticks
the first one I'm going to use white so
just dip about the centimeter or so into
that white chocolate and insert it into
the flat bottom of your first round cake
pop ball for your second fun we can do
this from white as well all that skin
color once again into the bottom the
flat sort of side of your round cake pop
ball for a little dragon stuffy it's a
little bit different you want to insert
your lollipop stick in and you want to
make sure that you don't put it too
close to this smaller end or your
cakepops going to crack so dip into your
blue chocolate and then you want to put
it up sort of on an angle so you can see
there I'm twisting as I push it in but
what you've got is a bit of an angle so
that snout is sort of tilting down and
the smaller back of the head is tilting
up while those ones are setting we're
gonna start making some of our
accessories so take your mini Oreo and
just split it in half this it's gonna
make the base of chilly the snowman's
hat take your soft eating licorice or
you could also use a tootsie roll here a
bit of black fondant and just cut it in
half and then put down a little bit of
that blue chocolate because this hat
actually has a little blue band around
it and you want to just take that soft
eating licorice and set it straight down
on the blue chocolate and you'll see the
little blue band poking out take your
piece of candy corn now and you can also
use some orange fondant or modeling
chocolate for this I really just want
the orange bit so I'm gonna cut off the
white and the yellow and because that
orange is still a little bit fat to be a
snowman nose I'm just going to just cut
off either side of it so that I've got a
really nice little mini carrot nose type
shape take one of your little love heart
sprinkles and just chop either side and
a tiny bit off the bottom just to make
it a bit of a smaller love heart for
lamby's notes now give your white
chocolate a really good stir I always
like to sturb right before I add it
because it gives you a really nice even
tip and take your first white dipped
cakepop ball so you're straight round
ball dip it down into your white
chocolate and just lightly tap off any
excess before your white chocolate dries
you want to stick the little hat and
also your little carrot nose onto
Chili's head and into this front of his
face and then pop him off into your
polystyrene block to set or we keep
working on stuffy the dragon take your
pretzel stick now and snap off a couple
of even length pieces we're gonna stick
those into the back of stuffies head for
his little dragon haunts a little bit of

you support your head as you're putting
these in so that you don't crack your
cake pop and I'm just pushing them ever
since likely a millimeter or so into
that cake pop with that melted blue
chocolate to stick you want to get your
white sprinkles ready and you'll notice
my melted chocolate is in quite a deep
container because we've got to allow for
the room of those horns and that oddly
shaped head so just dip your stuffy down
nice and carefully making sure that you
don't scrape those horns against the
bottom of your cup or else you're gonna
knock them how pull him out and
gently tap off any excess before that
dries you want to get your two white
bowl sprinkles on and then you can pop
him off into the polystyrene block and
he can set dip your cocktail stick into
a little bit of that blue chocolate and
just give your chilly this snowman a
really nice little fine light blue to
smile with that chocolate and then you
want to take your edible marker and give
chilly his eyes so they've kind of got
like a flat line going across the bottom
and then like a tall semicircle on top
and I love using americolor markers I
find they're one of the best edible
markers for drawing on your cake pops
and drawing on chocolate in general take
a tiny dot of melted white chocolate and
just one little dot in the corner of
each eye just to give chilly some
brights to his eyes stuffy the dragon
should now be nice and dry so lay them
down on the table and you want to take
your ziplock bag and a bit of that
melted blue chocolate just scoop the
melted chocolate in there push it all
the way down to the end and seal the bag
up before just snipping off a nice
little end it doesn't have to be
particularly fine we're just gonna use
this to trace over and give him some
eyelids so I'm just going about a third
of the way from the back of the eye and
just drawing a line straight across
those eyeballs and then coming around
the back of stuffies head and just
filling it in it doesn't have to be too
terribly need it's just to give him the
idea of those little sort of eyeballs
with the eyelids covering them and to
bring the eyes more into the cake pop
you can take a little skewer toothpick
and just Neen it up a little bit and
fill in any bits that you might have
missed with the ziplock bag and then
just grab the ziplock bag again and
you're just gonna give him two little
nostrils so just one dot and then
another on the top of each side of his
nice rounded snap like so taking stuffy
again while you've still got that melted
chocolate in the ziplock bag we're just
gonna give him a little scarf so just
lay him on his side and just trace
around the bottom of his neck just in a
bit of a a circle I guess or a line and
then I just came down the lollipop stick
to give him those two little tassels of
his little blue scarf that's chilly
pretty much finished taking off to the
side until the games ready to join him
moving on to Lambie so take your very
very pale fleshy colored chocolate and
once again we're just gonna dip that

give it a little tap don't let it dry
too much here you want to take your to
roll candies and
again I used pink here stick them in
either side of lamby's head and you also
want to take that tiny tiny little nose
love hot nose and stick it right smack
bang in the front sort of on the bottom
line of those two ears so you should
have something that looks a little bit
like this while that one setting you can
take your edible marker and we're just
gonna give stuffy his smile so he's got
quite a big wide smile and you want it
to go all the way from one side to the
other across that nice rounded snout all
right nice rounded head you also just
want to outline the little nostrils so
just a little semicircle in each nostril
just to give them a little bit of
definition and then you want to take

nice big round black pupils that's stuff
he finished they pop him off into the
polystyrene block with chilli and let's
keep going with Lambie just like we did
with that blue chocolate you want to tip
some of your white chocolate into your
ziplock bag
smooth it down push out any air seal it
up and just cut off a nice little tip we
want to start outlining lamby's head so
I'm gonna start under one of her ears
and come around to the other one kind of
like an abraham lincoln style of beard
and you just want to fill it in under to
do this in small sections because
otherwise your white chocolates going to
dry and you're not gonna have time to
get their sprinkles to stick to the
entire thing at once so start with the
underside of her chin sprinkle on some
of those white sprinkles and this is
where your tray comes in because this
will make a mess once you've done that
first section I like to outline her ears
next so just using the ziplock bag leave
the pink center of the ears visible so
that you can see the white on the
outside and a little bit of pink in the
middle
and once again just tip those sprinkles
over once both ears are done it's time
to do her fringe so with the fringe you
kind of want like three little sections
of fringe you can see there as I'm
coloring in the white chocolate if I
hold her up to show you you can see
she's almost got like sort of three
little half circles with the back make
sure that you're filling in all of the
spare space even if you're going over
the sprinkles and after you sprinkle
those last lot of sprinkles on use your
finger and just Pat down around that
last joint because if your joints going
to shop anywhere it's gonna be on that
last section across the back of lamby's
head all right
so Lambie should still be relatively
dead
so you should just be able to stick her
to little love heart sort of bow
sprinkles into the top of her head but
if she's not just use a tiny tiny dollop
of white chocolate to give those
something to adhere to beautiful take
your edible marker again and for final
details you just want to give her two
sort of small circle black eyes and for
her mouth it's just the little line
coming down from the point of that love
heart and the two little semi circles to
give her a little layer mouth also give
it two tiny tiny eyelashes on each eye
and a tiny dot of white chocolate in
each eye just brings that a life now
these doc mcstuffins templates are a
